newsitem.title: POLAND: Bank PBK to raise stake in Kredyt Bank.
newsitem.headline: Bank PBK to raise stake in Kredyt Bank.

text.p: Polish bank Kredyt Bank SA will issue 7.5 million to 10 million new shares to Powszechny Bank Kredytowy SA as part of the two banks' plan to exchange 25-percent stakes, Kredyt Bank said in a statement on Monday.
The issue would be worth 37.5 million to 50 million zlotys, the statement said.
In July PBK bought 4.4 million Kredyt Bank shares after the two banks agreed that each would hold about 25 percent of the other after Kredyt Bank takes part in PBK's privatisation due next year.
"The issue of new shares is linked with Kredyt Bank's declaration to take part in the privatisation of PBK SA," the Monday statement said.

Kredyt said it would also issue 635,000 to 847,000 new shares worth 3.175 million to 4.235 million zlotys to the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) so as not to dilute the EBRD's stake.
The EBRD currently has two million Kredyt Bank shares.

Kredyt said the move would have to be ratified at an extraordinary shareholders' meeting set for October 23, where shareholders would also vote whether to give the bank the right to issue convertible bonds.
